div.p: This page provides a list of the FHIR artifacts defined as part of this implementation guide.

{% capture grouping_desc %}The following artifacts define the specific capabilities that different types of systems are expected to have in order to comply with this implementation guide. Systems conforming to this implementation guide are expected to declare conformance to one or more of the following capability statements.{% endcapture %} {{ grouping_desc | markdownify}}

tr.td: {% capture desc %}This Section describes the expected capabilities of the US Core Client which is responsible for creating and initiating the queries for information about an individual patient. The complete list of FHIR profiles, RESTful operations, and search parameters supported by US Core Servers are defined in the [Conformance Requirements for Server](CapabilityStatement-us-core-server.html). US Core Clients have the option of choosing from this list to access necessary data based on their local use cases and other contextual requirements.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}This Section describes the expected capabilities of the US Core Server actor which is responsible for providing responses to the queries submitted by the US Core Requestors. The complete list of FHIR profiles, RESTful operations, and search parameters supported by US Core Servers are defined. Systems implementing this capability statement should meet the ONC 2015 Common Clinical Data Set (CCDS) access requirement for Patient Selection 170.315(g)(7) and Application Access - Data Category Request 170.315(g)(8) and the ONC [U.S. Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI) Version 2 July 2021](https://www.healthit.gov/isa/sites/isa/files/2021-07/USCDI-Version-2-July-2021-Final.pdf). US Core Clients have the option of choosing from this list to access necessary data based on their local use cases and other contextual requirements.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

div.p: {% capture grouping_desc %}These are custom operations that can be supported by and/or invoked by systems conforming to this implementation guide{% endcapture %} {{ grouping_desc | markdownify}}

tr.td:
{% capture desc %}This operation is used to return all the references to documents related to a patient.
The operation requires a patient id and takes the optional input parameters: - start date - end date - document type
and returns a [Bundle](http://hl7.org/fhir/bundle.html) of type "searchset" containing [DocumentReference](http://hl7.org/fhir/documentreference.html) resources for the patient. The DocumentReference resources **SHOULD** conform to the [US Core DocumentReference Profiles](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/StructureDefinition/us-core-documentreference). If the server has or can create documents that are related to the patient, and that are available for the given user, the server returns the DocumentReference resources needed to support the records. The principle intended use for this operation is to provide a provider or patient with access to their available document information.
This operation is *different* from a search by patient and type and date range because:
1. It is used to request a server *generate* a document based on the specified parameters.
1. If no parameters are specified, the server SHALL return a DocumentReference to the patient's most current CCD
1. If the server cannot *generate* a document based on the specified parameters, the operation will return an empty search bundle.
This operation is the *same* as a FHIR RESTful search by patient,type and date range because:
1. References for *existing* documents that meet the requirements of the request SHOULD also be returned unless the client indicates they are only interested in 'on-demand' documents using the *on-demand* parameter.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

div.p: {% capture grouping_desc %}These define the properties by which a RESTful server can be searched. They can also be used for sorting and including related resources.{% endcapture %} {{ grouping_desc | markdownify}}

tr.td: {% capture desc %}**active | inactive | resolved** **NOTE**: This US Core SearchParameter definition extends the usage context of the [Conformance expectation extension](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extension-capabilitystatement-expectation.html) - multipleAnd - multipleOr - comparator - modifier - chain{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}**Logical id of this artifact** **NOTE**: This US Core SearchParameter definition extends the usage context of the [Conformance expectation extension](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extension-capabilitystatement-expectation.html) - multipleAnd - multipleOr - comparator - modifier - chain{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}**Search by subject - a patient** **NOTE**: This US Core SearchParameter definition extends the usage context of the [Conformance expectation extension](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extension-capabilitystatement-expectation.html) - multipleAnd - multipleOr - comparator - modifier - chain{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}**draft | active | on-hold | revoked | completed | entered-in-error | unknown** **NOTE**: This US Core SearchParameter definition extends the usage context of the [Conformance expectation extension](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extension-capabilitystatement-expectation.html) - multipleAnd - multipleOr - comparator - modifier - chain{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

div.p: {% capture grouping_desc %}These are profiles on resources or data types that describe patterns used by other profiles, but cannot be instantiated directly. I.e. instances can conform to profiles *based* on these abstract profiles, but do not declare conformance to the abstract profiles themselves.{% endcapture %} {{ grouping_desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core Social History Assessment Observation Profile

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Profile for simple observations made by an individual about a patient's social history status such as education, food insecurity, etc. These observation involve assessment by a provider, payer, etc. as opposed to being derived only from screening surveys which should be represented using the [US Core Screening Response Observation Profile](StructureDefinition-us-core-observation-screening-response.html){% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

div.p: {% capture grouping_desc %}These define constraints on FHIR resources for systems conforming to this implementation guide{% endcapture %} {{ grouping_desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core Pediatric Head Occipital-frontal Circumference Percentile Profile

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Defines constraints on the Observation resource to represent head occipital-frontal circumference percentile for patients from birth to 36 months of age in FHIR using a standard LOINC code and UCUM units of measure. This profile is derived from the US Core Vital Signs Profile.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the AllergyIntolerance resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve allergy information.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Defines constraints on Observation to represent diastolic and systolic blood pressure observations with standard LOINC codes and UCUM units of measure. This profile is derived from the US Core Vital Signs Profile.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Defines constraints on Observation to represent Body Mass Index (BMI) observations with a standard LOINC code and UCUM units of measure. This profile is derived from the US Core Vital Signs Profile.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Defines constraints on Observation to represent body height observations with a standard LOINC code and UCUM units of measure. This profile is derived from the US Core Vital Signs Profile.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Defines constraints on Observation to represent body temperature observations with a standard LOINC code and UCUM units of measure. This profile is derived from the US Core Vital Signs Profile.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Defines constraints on Observation to represent body weight observations with a standard LOINC code and UCUM units of measure. This profile is derived from the US Core Vital Signs Profile.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the CarePlan resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve a patient's Care Plan.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the CareTeam resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve a patient's Care Team.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the Condition resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve problems and health concerns information.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core DiagnosticReport Profile for Laboratory Results Reporting

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the DiagnosticReport resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve diagnostic reports associated with laboratory results for a patient{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core DiagnosticReport Profile for Report and Note exchange

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the DiagnosticReport resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve diagnostic reports associated with clinical notes for a patient{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}The document reference profile used in US Core.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}The Encounter referenced in the US Core profiles.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the Goal resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve a patient's goal(s).{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Defines constraints on Observation to represent head circumference observations with a standard LOINC code and UCUM units of measure. This profile is derived from the US Core Vital Signs Profile.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Defines constraints on Observation to represent heart rate observations with a standard LOINC code and UCUM units of measure. This profile is derived from the US Core Vital Signs Profile.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the Immunization resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve patient's immunization information.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the Device resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve a patient's implantable device(s).{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Defines basic constraints and extensions on the Location resource for use with other US Core resources{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the Medication resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve patient retrieving patient's medication information.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the MedicationRequest resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve prescription information.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core Clinical Test Result Observation Profile

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the Observation resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve clinical test results{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core Imaging Result Observation Profile

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the Observation resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve structured and unstructured (narrative) components of imaging test results. These observations include reasons, findings, and impressions.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core Laboratory Result Observation Profile

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the Observation resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve laboratory test results{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core Screening Response Observation Profile

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Profile for observations that represent question and answer pairs from from surveys/questionnaires such as Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) screening instruments.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core Sexual Orientation Observation Profile

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the Observation resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve a Patient's Sexual Orientation.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Defines basic constraints and extensions on the Organization resource for use with other US Core resources{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core Pediatric BMI for Age Observation Profile

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Defines constraints on Observation to represent to represent BMI percentile per age and sex for youth 2-20 observations in FHIR using a standard LOINC code and UCUM units of measure. This profile is derived from the US Core Vital Signs Profile.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core Pediatric Weight for Height Observation Profile

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Defines constraints on the Observation resource to represent pediatric Weight-for-length per age and gender observations in FHIR with a standard LOINC code and UCUM units of measure. This profile is derived from the US Core Vital Signs Profile.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}The practitioner(s) referenced in US Core profiles.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}The practitioner roles referenced in the US Core profiles.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the Procedure resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve patient's procedure information. This profile can be used to record a service or intervention that is or was performed on or for a patient.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Draft set of requirements to satisfy Basic Provenance Requirements.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Defines constraints on the Observation resource to represent inspired O2 by pulse oximetry and inspired oxygen concentration observations with a standard LOINC codes and UCUM units of measure. This profile is derived from the US Core Vital Signs Profile.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the RelatedPerson resource on the patient resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve demographic information.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Defines constraints on Observation to represent respiratory rate observations with a standard LOINC code and UCUM units of measure. This profile is derived from the US Core Vital Signs Profile.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core Smoking Status Observation Profile

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the Observation resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve patient's Smoking Status information.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Defines constraints on the Observation resource to represent vital signs observations. This profile is used as the base definition for the other US Core Vital Signs Profiles and based on the FHIR VitalSigns Profile.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the patient resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve patient demographic information.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Defines constraints and extensions on the ServiceRequest resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve orders associated with diagnostic and clinical tests and clinical interventions for a patient{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

div.p: {% capture grouping_desc %}These define constraints on FHIR data types for systems conforming to this implementation guide{% endcapture %} {{ grouping_desc | markdownify}}

tr.td: {% capture desc %}A code classifying the person's sex assigned at birth as specified by the [Office of the National Coordinator for Health IT (ONC)](https://www.healthit.gov/newsroom/about-onc). This extension aligns with the C-CDA Birth Sex Observation (LOINC 76689-9).{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}This email address is associated with a [direct](http://wiki.directproject.org/Addressing+Specification) service. This extension can only be used on contact points where the system = 'email'{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Concepts classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, geographical origin or nationality. The ethnicity codes used to represent these concepts are based upon the [CDC ethnicity and Ethnicity Code Set Version 1.0](http://www.cdc.gov/phin/resources/vocabulary/index.html) which includes over 900 concepts for representing race and ethnicity of which 43 reference ethnicity. The ethnicity concepts are grouped by and pre-mapped to the 2 OMB ethnicity categories: - Hispanic or Latino - Not Hispanic or Latino.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}This extension provides concepts to describe the gender a person identifies as.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Concepts classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, geographical origin or nationality. The race codes used to represent these concepts are based upon the [CDC Race and Ethnicity Code Set Version 1.0](http://www.cdc.gov/phin/resources/vocabulary/index.html) which includes over 900 concepts for representing race and ethnicity of which 921 reference race. The race concepts are grouped by and pre-mapped to the 5 OMB race categories:
- American Indian or Alaska Native - Asian - Black or African American - Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander - White.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

div.p: {% capture grouping_desc %}These define sets of codes used by systems conforming to this implementation guide{% endcapture %} {{ grouping_desc | markdownify}}

tr.td: {% capture desc %}The codes for the concepts 'Unknown', 'Asked but no answer', 'other, and the 41 [CDC ethnicity codes](http://www.cdc.gov/phin/resources/vocabulary/index.html) that are grouped under one of the 2 OMB ethnicity category codes.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}The codes for the concepts 'Unknown', 'Asked but no answer', 'other, and the 900+ [CDC Race codes](http://www.cdc.gov/phin/resources/vocabulary/index.html) that are grouped under one of the 5 OMB race category codes.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}[National Uniform Billing Committee](http://www.nubc.org/), manual UB-04, UB form locator 17.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}The codes for the concepts 'Unknown', 'Asked but no answer', and the ethnicity categories - 'Hispanic or Latino' and 'Non Hispanic or Latino' - as defined by the [OMB Standards for Maintaining, Collecting, and Presenting Federal Data on Race and Ethnicity, Statistical Policy Directive No. 15, as revised, October 30, 1997](https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/FR-1997-10-30/pdf/97-28653.pdf).{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}The codes for the concepts 'Unknown', 'Asked but no answer', 'other, and the codes for the five race categories - 'American Indian' or 'Alaska Native', 'Asian', 'Black or African American', 'Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander', and 'White' - as defined by the [OMB Standards for Maintaining, Collecting, and Presenting Federal Data on Race and Ethnicity, Statistical Policy Directive No. 15, as revised, October 30, 1997](https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/FR-1997-10-30/pdf/97-28653.pdf) .{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: Language codes with language and optionally a region modifier

tr.td: {% capture desc %}This value set includes codes from [BCP-47](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). This value set matches the ONC 2015 Edition LanguageCommunication data element value set within C-CDA to use a 2 character language code if one exists, and a 3 character code if a 2 character code does not exist. It points back to [RFC 5646](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5646), however only the language codes are required, all other elements are optional.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Codes for assigning sex at birth as specified by the [Office of the National Coordinator for Health IT (ONC)](https://www.healthit.gov/newsroom/about-onc){% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}The US Core Clinical Note Type Value Set is a 'starter set' of types supported for fetching and storing clinical notes.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core Common SDOH Assessments ValueSet

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Common SDOH assessment concepts covering the following categories (Gravity Project SDOH Domains): - Food (Food Insecurity) - Housing (Housing Instability) - Health (Social Connection, Stress) - Employment (Employment Status) - Care (SDOH Category Unspecified) - Transit (Transportation Insecurity) - Money (Financial Insecurity) - Goods (Material Hardship) - Education (SDOH Category Unspecified) - Legal (SDOH Category Unspecified){% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}TheUS Core Condition Category Codessupport the separate concepts of problems, health concerns, and Social Determinants of Health inCondition.categoryin order for API consumers to be able to separate them.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}This describes the problem. Diagnosis/Problem List is broadly defined as a series of brief statements that catalog a patient's medical, nursing, dental, social, preventative and psychiatric events and issues that are relevant to that patient's healthcare (e.g., signs, symptoms, and defined conditions). ICD-10 is appropriate for Diagnosis information, and ICD-9 for historical information.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core Diagnostic Report Category Codes

tr.td: {% capture desc %}The US Core Diagnostic Report Category Value Set is a 'starter set' of categories supported for fetching and Diagnostic Reports and notes.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core Diagnostic Report Laboratory Codes

tr.td: {% capture desc %}The Document Type value set includes all LOINC values whose CLASSTYPE is LABORATORY in the LOINC database{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Non laboratory LOINC concepts such as codes for observations like vital signs, hemodynamics, intake/output, EKG, obstetric ultrasound, cardiac echo and other clinical observations. The codes selected should represent discrete and narrative diagnostic observations and reports{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}The US Core DocumentReferences Category Value Set is a 'starter set' of categories supported for fetching and storing clinical notes.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}The US Core DocumentReference Type Value Set includes all LOINC values whose SCALE is DOC in the LOINC database and the HL7 v3 Code System NullFlavor concept 'unknown'{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}The type of encounter: a specific code indicating type of service provided. This value set includes codes from SNOMED CT decending from the concept 308335008 (Patient encounter procedure (procedure)) and codes from the Current Procedure and Terminology (CPT) found in the following CPT sections:
- 99201-99499 E/M
- 99500-99600 home health (mainly nonphysician, such as newborn care in home)
- 99605-99607 medication management
- 98966-98968 non physician telephone services
(subscription to AMA Required){% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Concepts from CPT and LOINC code systems that can be used to indicate the goal.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}The US Core Narrative Status Value Set limits the text status for the resource narrative.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}HL7 FHIR concepts to classify an observation{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Representing a patients smoking behavior using concepts from SNOMED CT.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core Status for Smoking Status Observation

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Codes providing the status of an observation for smoking status. Constrained to `final`and `entered-in-error`.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}[Snomed-CT](http://www.ihtsdo.org/) concept codes for coded results{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Concepts from CPT, SNOMED CT, HCPCS Level II Alphanumeric Codes, ICD-10-PCS,CDT and LOINC code systems that can be used to indicate the type of procedure performed.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core Provenance Participant Type Codes

tr.td: {% capture desc %}The type of participation a provenance agent played for a given target.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Provider roles codes which are composed of the NUCC Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set classification codes for providers. Only concepts with a classification and no specialization are included.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}A set of SNOMED CT and LOINC concepts to classify a requested service{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}The US Core Sexual Orientation Value Set includes concepts to describe a persons sexual orientation (who they are attracted to).{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core Smoking Status Observation Codes

tr.td: {% capture desc %}The US Core Smoking Status Observation Codes Value Set is a 'starter set' of concepts to capture smoking status.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}This value set defines two letter USPS alphabetic codes.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}The vital sign codes from the base FHIR and US Core Vital Signs.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

div.p: {% capture grouping_desc %}These define new code systems used by systems conforming to this implementation guide{% endcapture %} {{ grouping_desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core CarePlan Category Extension Codes

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Set of codes that are needed for implementation of the US-Core CarePlan Profile. These codes are used as extensions to the FHIR ValueSet.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core Condition Category Extension Codes

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Set of codes that are needed for implementation of the US-Core Condition Profile. These codes are used as extensions to the FHIR and US Core value sets.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}The US Core DocumentReferences Type Code System is a 'starter set' of categories supported for fetching and storing DocumentReference Resources.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: US Core Provenance Participant Type Extension Codes

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Set of codes that are needed for implementation of the US-Core Provenance Profile. These codes are used as extensions to the FHIR value sets.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
